text:
Message 3103 of 4024
I started with a pretty snarky mail about your nuking all our subscriptions from Microsoft to Comcast to Apple so we pay not only double and triple
now but we have no family sharing either.
So I’ll just let you know that one of the kids Xbox Live subscriptions has expired and I would prefer that we let me use the Microsoft discount I
earned rather than go your route on these.
I honestly don’t know what the harm is letting me see what language Adrian is taking in Duolingo or Max’s favorite game pack that he’s downloaded .
Even if it is tracking, it’s my kids too, right?
Sent:06/10/2024 at 04:43 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/10/2024 at 04:53 PM)
Subject:Xbox Live
Message 3104 of 4024
Yes using the discount makes sense. Whose subscription expired?
Sent:06/10/2024 at 04:54 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 06/10/2024 at 04:54 PM)
Subject:Re: Xbox Live
Message 3105 of 4024
You’ve canceled them all why are you saying that now?
Sent:06/10/2024 at 04:54 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/10/2024 at 09:37 PM)
Subject:Re: Xbox Live
Message 3106 of 4024
I didn’t even know this one existed...
I’m a little concerned about doing a repeat of Max and I. At this point I can’t really ask him to get off my email. He’s had it for Xbox as his gamertag
for years.

From:Robert Moyer

Subject:Re: Xbox Live
